title: Citi Takes Eight FX Week Best Bank Awards
summary: London - Citi, the leading global foreign exchange house, has secured the top place in eight different categories in FX Week's annual Best Bank awards. It won more individual awards than any other bank.
tag-1: Citi Takes Eight FX Week Best Bank Awards
tag-2: London – Citi, the leading global foreign exchange house, has secured the top place in eight different categories in FX Week's annual Best Bank awards. It won more individual awards than any other bank.
tag-3: It was named the best bank for FX for investors, the best bank for spot FX, the best bank for FX prime brokerage, the best bank for FX in North America, the best bank for U.S. dollars/Japanese yen, the best bank for emerging Latin American currencies, the best bank for FX research and strategy and the best bank for algorithmic trading.
tag-4: This tally represents an improvement from last year, when Citi won six awards from FX Week. "Citi is obviously delighted and proud to be recognised by FX Week for its achievements in foreign exchange markets in 2012. It underlines both the importance of this business to Citi and our position at the forefront of the industry," said Jeff Feig, global head of G10 FX.
tag-5: Commenting on the awards, FX Week said, "The eight awards leave little doubt of Citi's continuing strength in foreign exchange, and its capacity for product innovation and trading expertise in challenging markets."
tag-6: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
